metadata.Title: CVE-2018-15853 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
Endless recursion exists in xkbcomp/expr.c in xkbcommon and libxkbcommon before 0.8.1, which could be used by local attackers to crash xkbcommon users by supplying a crafted keymap file that triggers boolean negation.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-15853` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxkbcommon-x11-0 - 0.5.0-1ubuntu2.1
libxkbcommon0 - 0.5.0-1ubuntu2.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libxkbcommon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.5.0-1ubuntu2.1').
